Exception.Description: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns of data set couldn't be found.

Messages.Default: One or more specified columns were not found.
Messages.Message: Column with name or index "{column_id}" not found.
Column with name or index "{column_id}" does not exist in "{arg_name_missing_column}".
Column with name or index "{column_id}" does not exist in "{arg_name_missing_column}", but exists in "{arg_name_has_column}".
Columns with name or index "{column_names}" not found.
Columns with name or index "{column_names}" does not exist in "{arg_name_missing_column}".
Columns with name or index "{column_names}" does not exist in "{arg_name_missing_column}", but exists in "{arg_name_has_column}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from specified type into required by target method type.

Messages.Default: Failed to parse parameter.
Messages.Message: Failed to parse "{arg_name_or_column}" parameter.
Failed to parse "{arg_name_or_column}" parameter with the value of "{arg_value}".
Failed to convert "{arg_name_or_column}" parameter to "{to_type}".
Failed to convert "{arg_name_or_column}" parameter from "{from_type}" to "{to_type}".
Failed to convert "{arg_name_or_column}" parameter value "{arg_value}" from "{from_type}" to "{to_type}".
Failed to convert value "{arg_value}" in column "{arg_name_or_column}" from "{from_type}" to "{to_type}" with usage of the format "{fmt}" provided.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

Messages.Default: One or more of inputs are null or empty.
Messages.Message: Input "{name}" is null or empty.
Input "{name}" is null or empty. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if parameter is less than or equal to specific value.

Messages.Default: Parameter should be greater than boundary value.
Messages.Message: Parameter "{arg_name}" value should be greater than {lower_boundary}.
Parameter "{arg_name}" has value "{actual_value}" which should be greater than {lower_boundary}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if parameter is less than a specific value.

Messages.Default: Parameter should be greater than or equal to boundary value.
Messages.Message: Parameter "{arg_name}" value should be greater than or equal to {lower_boundary}.
Parameter "{arg_name}" has value "{value}" which should be greater than or equal to {lower_boundary}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if parameter is greater than or equal to the specified value.

Messages.Default: Parameters mismatch. One of the parameters should be less than another.
Messages.Message: Parameter "{arg_name}" value should be less than parameter "{upper_boundary_parameter_name}" value.
Parameter "{arg_name}" has value "{value}" which should be less than {upper_boundary_parameter_name}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if parameter is greater than a specific value.

Messages.Default: Parameters mismatch. One of the parameters should be less than or equal to another.
Messages.Message: Parameter "{arg_name}" value should be less than or equal to parameter "{upper_boundary_parameter_name}" value.
Parameter "{arg_name}" has value "{actual_value}" which should be less than or equal to {upper_boundary}.
Parameter "{arg_name}" value {actual_value} should be less than or equal to parameter "{upper_boundary_parameter_name}" value {upper_boundary}.
Parameter "{arg_name}" value {actual_value} should be less than or equal to {upper_boundary_meaning} value {upper_boundary}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if parameter is not in range.

Messages.Default: Parameter value is not in the specified range.
Messages.Message: Parameter "{arg_name}" value is not in range.
Parameter "{arg_name}" value should be in the range of [{lower_boundary}, {upper_boundary}].
Parameter "{arg_name}" value is not in range. {reason}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if Azure storage account name or container name specified incorrectly.

Messages.Default: The Azure storage account name or container name is incorrect.
Messages.Message: The Azure storage account name "{account_name}" or container name "{container_name}" is incorrect; a container name of the format container/blob was expected.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if input datasets have column names that should match but do not.

Messages.Default: Columns with corresponding index in input datasets have different names.
Messages.Message: Column names are not the same for column {col_index} (zero-based) of input datasets ({dataset1} and {dataset2} respectively).

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if passed column set argument does not apply to any of dataset columns.

Messages.Default: Specified column set does not apply to any of dataset columns.
Messages.Message: Specified column set "{column_set}" does not apply to any of dataset columns.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if instance of class could not be created with passed set of arguments.

Messages.Default: Untrained model, please train model first.
Messages.Message: Untrained model ({arg_name}), use trained model.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if passed to module learner has invalid type.

Messages.Default: Invalid input type is passed.
Messages.Message: Input "{arg_name}" has invalid type.
Input "{arg_name}" has invalid type "{learner_type}".
Input "{arg_name}" has invalid type "{learner_type}". {troubleshoot_hint}
Invalid input type is passed. Exception message: {exception_message}
Input "{arg_name}" has invalid type. Exception message: {exception_message}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if amount of column unique values is greater than allowed.

Messages.Default: Amount of column unique values is greater than allowed.
Messages.Message: Number of unique values in column: "{column_name}" is greater than allowed. {troubleshoot_hint}
Number of unique values in column: "{column_name}" exceeds tuple count of {limitation}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if database connection has failed.

Messages.Default: Error making database connection.
Messages.Message: Error making database connection: {connection_str}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if input datasets passed to the module should have compatible column types but do not.

Messages.Default: Columns with corresponding index in input datasets do have incompatible types.
Messages.Message: Columns '{first_col_names}' are incompatible between train and test data.
Columns '{first_col_names}' and '{second_col_names}' are incompatible.
Column element types are not compatible for column '{first_col_names}' (zero-based) of input datasets ({first_dataset_names} and {second_dataset_names} respectively).

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns have type unsupported by current module.

Messages.Default: Cannot process column of current type. The type is not supported by the module.
Messages.Message: Cannot process column of type {col_type}. The type is not supported by the module.
Cannot process column "{col_name}" of type {col_type}. The type is not supported by the module.
Cannot process column "{col_name}" of type {col_type}. The type is not supported by the module. Parameter name: {arg_name}.
Cannot process column "{col_name}" of type {col_type}. Reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if input dataset is not valid.

Messages.Default: Dataset is not valid.
Messages.Message: Dataset is not valid. {reason}
{dataset1} contains invalid data.
{dataset1} and {dataset2} should be consistent columnwise.
{dataset1} contains invalid data, {reason}.
{dataset1} contains {invalid_data_category}. {troubleshoot_hint}
{dataset1} is not valid, reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if column is expected to contain sorted values, but it does not.

Messages.Default: Values in column are not sorted.
Messages.Message: Values in column "{col_index}" are not sorted.
Values in column "{col_index}" of dataset "{dataset}" are not sorted.
Values in argument "{arg_name}" are not sorted in "{sorting_order}" order.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if number of columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

Messages.Default: Number of columns in input dataset is less than allowed minimum.
Messages.Message: Number of columns in input dataset "{arg_name}" is less than allowed minimum.
Number of columns in input dataset is less than allowed minimum of {required_columns_count} column(s).
Number of columns in input dataset "{arg_name}" is less than allowed minimum of {required_columns_count} column(s).

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if number of rows in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

Messages.Default: Number of rows in input dataset is less than allowed minimum.
Messages.Message: Number of rows in input dataset is less than allowed minimum of {required_rows_count} row(s).
Number of rows in input dataset is less than allowed minimum of {required_rows_count} row(s). {reason}
Number of rows in input dataset is less than allowed minimum of {required_rows_count} row(s). Reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}
Number of rows in input dataset "{arg_name}" is less than allowed minimum of {required_rows_count} row(s).
Number of rows in input dataset "{arg_name}" is {actual_rows_count}, less than allowed minimum of {required_rows_count} row(s).
Number of "{row_type}" rows in input dataset "{arg_name}" is {actual_rows_count}, less than allowed minimum of {required_rows_count} row(s).

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.

Messages.Default: Number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.
Messages.Message: Number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to {expected_col_count}.
Column selection pattern "{selection_pattern_friendly_name}" provides number of selected columns in input dataset not equal to {expected_col_count}.

Column selection pattern "{selection_pattern_friendly_name}" is expected to provide {expected_col_count} column(s) selected in input dataset, but {selected_col_count} column(s) is/are actually provided.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if target column of input dataset is not valid for the current trainer module.

Messages.Default: Input dataset has unsupported target column.
Messages.Message: Input dataset has unsupported target column "{column_index}".
Input dataset has unsupported target column "{column_index}" for learner of type "{learner_type}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a label column.

Messages.Default: There is no label column in dataset.
Messages.Message: There is no label column in "{dataset_name}".
There is no label column in "{dataset_name}". {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a score column.

Messages.Default: There is no score column in dataset.
Messages.Message: There is no score column in "{dataset_name}".
There is no score column in "{dataset_name}" that is produced by a "{learner_type}". Score the dataset using the correct type of learner.
There is no "{column_name}" column in "{dataset_name}". {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if columns with the same name is not allowed.

Messages.Default: Equal column names are specified in arguments. Equal column names are not allowed by module.
Messages.Message: Equal column names in arguments "{arg_name_1}" and "{arg_name_2}" are not allowed. Please specify different names.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in case when two objects have to be of the same size but are not.

Messages.Default: The size of passed objects is inconsistent.
Messages.Message: The size of "{friendly_name1}" is inconsistent with size of "{friendly_name2}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in the case when column set contains duplicated column names and it is not allowed.

Messages.Default: Column set contains duplicated column name(s).
Messages.Message: The name "{duplicated_name}" is duplicated.
The name "{duplicated_name}" is duplicated in "{arg_name}".
The name "{duplicated_name}" is duplicated. Details: {details}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in case when invalid URI is passed.

Messages.Default: Invalid Uri is passed.
Messages.Message: The Uri "{invalid_url}" is invalid.
Invalid Uri is passed. {message}

Exception.Description: Exception uccurs in the case when it is not possible to download a file.

Messages.Default: Unable to download a file.
Messages.Message: Error while downloading the file: {file_url}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if number of columns in column set is less than needed.

Messages.Default: Number of columns in column set is less than required.
Messages.Message: At least {required_columns_count} column(s) should be specified for input argument "{arg_name}".
At least {required_columns_count} column(s) should be specified for input argument "{arg_name}". The actual number of specified columns is {input_columns_count}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if argument is not a number.

Messages.Default: Argument is not a number.
Messages.Message: "{arg_name}" is not a number.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if argument is Infinity.

Messages.Default: Argument must be finite.
Messages.Message: "{arg_name}" is not finite.
Column "{column_name}" contains infinite values.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if more than one rating exists for a given user-item pair.

Messages.Default: More than one rating exist for the value(s) in dataset.
Messages.Message: More than one rating for user {user} and item {item} in rating prediction data table.
More than one rating for user {user} and item {item} in {dataset}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if no features were provided for a given user or item.

Messages.Default: No features were provided for a required user or item.
Messages.Message: Features for {required_feature_name} required but not provided.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if multiple feature vectors were provided for a given user or item.

Messages.Default: Duplicate feature definition for a user or item.
Messages.Message: Duplicate feature definition for "{duplicated_name}" in "{dataset}". {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if multiple label columns are specified and just one is allowed.

Messages.Default: Multiple label columns are specified.
Messages.Message: Multiple label columns are specified in "{dataset_name}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if operation has failed.

Messages.Default: Operation failed.
Messages.Message: Error while completing operation: "{failed_operation}".
Error while completing operation: "{failed_operation}". Reason: "{reason}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when it is not possible to convert column to another type.

Messages.Default: Not allowed conversion.
Messages.Message: Could not convert column of type {type1} to column of type {type2}.
Could not convert column "{col_name1}" of type {type1} to column of type {type2}.
Could not convert column "{col_name1}" of type {type1} to column "{col_name2}" of type {type2}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when it is not possible to derive element type of column from the existing values.

Messages.Default: Cannot derive element type of the column.
Messages.Message: Cannot derive element type for column "{column_name}" -- all the elements are null references.
Cannot derive element type for column "{column_name}" of dataset "{dataset_name}" -- all the elements are null references.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when it is not possible to create a column because of mixed element types in the source.

Messages.Default: Cannot create column with mixed element types.
Messages.Message: Cannot create column with id "{column_id}" of mixed element types: Type of data[{row_1}, {column_id}] is "{type_1}" Type of data[{row_2}, {column_id}] is "{type_2}".
Cannot create column with id "{column_id}" of mixed element types: Type in chunk {chunk_id_1} is "{type_1}" Type in chunk {chunk_id_2} is "{type_2}" with chunk size: {chunk_size}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when it is not possible to create directory on specified path.

Messages.Default: Please specify a valid output directory.
Messages.Message: Directory: {path} cannot be created. Please specify valid path.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if number of feature columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

Messages.Default: Number of feature columns in input dataset is less than allowed minimum.
Messages.Message: Number of feature columns in input dataset is less than allowed minimum of {required_columns_count} column(s).
Number of feature columns in input dataset "{arg_name}" is less than allowed minimum of {required_columns_count} column(s).

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in the case when it is not possible to open a file.

Messages.Default: Unable to open a file.
Messages.Message: Error while opening the file: {file_name}.
Error while opening the file: {file_name}. Storage exception message: {exception}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in the case when it is not possible to parse a file.

Messages.Default: Unable to parse a file.
Messages.Message: Error while parsing the {file_format} file.
Error while parsing the {file_format} file: {file_name}.
Error while parsing the {file_format} file. Reason: {failure_reason}.
Error while parsing the {file_format} file: {file_name}. Reason: {failure_reason}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if Azure storage account key is specified incorrectly.

Messages.Default: The Azure storage account key is incorrect.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in the case when there are no user features or items for machbox reccomendations.

Messages.Default: User features or/and items are required but not provided.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if columns are selected in a column picker violates the Selected Columns Category constraint.

Messages.Default: One or more selected columns were not in an allowed category.
Messages.Message: Column with name "{col_name}" is not in an allowed category. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when attempting to create a file or blob that already exists.

Messages.Default: File or Blob already exists.
Messages.Message: File or Blob "{file_path}" already exists.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain the expected label column.

Messages.Default: The label column values and scored label column values are not comparable.
Messages.Message: The label column is not as expected in "{dataset_name}".
The label column is not as expected in "{dataset_name}", {reason}.
The label column "{column_name}" is not expected in "{dataset_name}".
The label column "{column_name}" is not expected in "{dataset_name}", {reason}.
The label column "{column_name}" is not expected in "{dataset_name}". Reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if a column index specified in a column picker cannot be parsed.

Messages.Default: One or more specified column indexes or index ranges could not be parsed.
Messages.Message: Column index or range "{column_index_or_range}" could not be parsed.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when an out of range column range is specified in a column picker.

Messages.Default: Invalid or out of range column index range specified.
Messages.Message: Column range "{column_range}" is invalid or out of range.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when attempting to add a row to a DataTable that has a different number of columns than the table.

Messages.Default: All tables must have the same number of columns.
Messages.Message: Columns in chunk "{chunk_id_1}" is different with chunk "{chunk_id_2}" with chunk size: {chunk_size}.
Column count in file "{filename_1}" (count={column_count_1}) is different with file "{filename_2}" (count={column_count_2}).

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when attempting to compare two models with different learner types.

Messages.Default: All models must have the same learner type.
Messages.Message: Got incompatible learner type: "{actual_learner_type}". Expected learner types are: "{expected_learner_type_list}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if Azure storage account name or storage key is specified incorrectly.

Messages.Default: The Azure storage account name or storage key is incorrect.
Messages.Message: The Azure storage account name "{account_name}" or storage key for the account name is incorrect.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if Azure blob name is specified incorrectly.

Messages.Default: The Azure storage blob name is incorrect.
Messages.Message: The Azure storage blob name "{blob_name}" is incorrect.
The Azure storage blob name with prefix "{blob_name_prefix}" does not exist.
Failed to find any Azure storage blobs under container "{container_name}".
Failed to find any Azure storage blobs with wildcard path "{blob_wildcard_path}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if a resource could not be uploaded to an Azure Blob.

Messages.Default: The resource could not be uploaded to Azure storage.
Messages.Message: The file "{source_path}" could not be uploaded to Azure storage as "{dest_path}".

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if a dataset has a different number of columns than expected.

Messages.Default: Unexpected number of columns in the datatable.
Messages.Message: Unexpected number of columns in the dataset "{dataset_name}".
Expected "{expected_column_count}" column(s) but found "{actual_column_count}" column(s) instead.
In input dataset "{dataset_name}", expected "{expected_column_count}" column(s) but found "{actual_column_count}" column(s) instead.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if the specified Hive script is not correct.

Messages.Default: Hive script is incorrect.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if the specified SQL script is not correct.

Messages.Default: SQL script is incorrect.
Messages.Message: SQL query "{sql_query}" is not correct.
SQL query "{sql_query}" is not correct. Exception message: {exception}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when attempting to access non-existent Azure table.

Messages.Default: Azure table does not exist.
Messages.Message: Azure table "{table_name}" does not exist.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in the case of connection timeout.

Messages.Default: Connection timeout occured.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if an error occurs while converting a column to another type.

Messages.Default: Failed to convert column.
Messages.Message: Failed to convert column to {target_type}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when an invalid binning function is used when quantizing a dataset.

Messages.Default: Invalid binning function used.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when unknown blob file write mode passed.

Messages.Default: Unsupported blob write mode.
Messages.Message: Unsupported blob write mode: {blob_write_mode}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when the Http Reader receives a 3xx status code indicating redirection.

Messages.Default: Http redirection not allowed.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if Azure storage container name is specified incorrectly.

Messages.Default: The Azure storage container name is incorrect.
Messages.Message: The Azure storage container name "{container_name}" is incorrect; a container name of the format container/blob was expected.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when column with all values missing is not allowed by module.

Messages.Default: Columns with all values missing are not allowed.
Messages.Message: Column {col_index_or_name} has all values missing.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs in PCA module if number of dimensions to reduce to is equal to number of feature columns in input dataset, containing at least one sparse feature column.

Messages.Default: For dataset containing sparse feature columns number of dimensions to reduce to should be less than number of feature columns.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when a model cannot be successfully deserialized.

Messages.Default: Model could not be deserialized because it is likely serialized with an older serialization format. Please retrain and re-save the model.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if dataset used for training cannot be used for concrete type of learner.

Messages.Default: Dataset used for training is invalid.
Messages.Message: {data_name} contains invalid data for training.
{data_name} contains invalid data for training. Learner type: {learner_type}.
{data_name} contains invalid data for training. Learner type: {learner_type}. Reason: {reason}.
Failed to apply "{action_name}" action on training data {data_name}. Reason: {reason}.
Failed to apply "{action_name}" action on training data "{data_name}". Reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when scores produced from an Custom Script are evaluated. This is currently unsupported.

Messages.Default: Evaluating scores produced by Custom Model is currently unsupported.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when script evaluation fails with an error.

Messages.Default: Error during evaluation of script.
Messages.Message: The following error occurred during script evaluation, please view the output log for more information: ---------- Start of error message from {script_language} interpreter ---------- {message} ---------- End of error message from {script_language} interpreter ----------

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when Hive table creation fails.

Messages.Default: The Hive table could not be created. For a HDInsight cluster, please ensure the Azure storage account name associated with cluster is the same as what is passed in through the module parameter.
Messages.Message: The Hive table "{table_name}" could not be created. For a HDInsight cluster, please ensure the Azure storage account name associated with cluster is the same as what is passed in through the module parameter.
The Hive table "{table_name}" could not be created. For a HDInsight cluster, please ensure the Azure storage account name associated with cluster is "{cluster_name}".

Exception.Description: Thrown when a ZIP file cannot be extracted

Messages.Default: Given ZIP file is not in the correct format.

Exception.Description: Thrown when a module definition file defines an unsupported parameter type

Messages.Default: Unsupported parameter type.
Messages.Message: Unsupported parameter type '{parameter_name}' specified.
Unsupported parameter type '{parameter_name}' specified. Reason: {reason}.

Exception.Description: Thrown when a module definition file defines an unsupported output type

Messages.Default: Unsupported output type.
Messages.Message: Unsupported output type '{output_type}' specified.

Exception.Description: Thrown when schema for multiple datasets do not match.

Messages.Default: Dataset schema does not match.

Exception.Description: Image pixel size exceeds allowed limit.

Messages.Default: Image pixel size exceeds allowed limit.
Messages.Message: Image pixel size in the file '{file_path}' exceeds allowed limit: '{size_limit}'.

Exception.Description: Number of conditional probabilities for categorical columns exceeds limit.

Messages.Default: Number of conditional probabilities for categorical columns exceeds limit.
Messages.Message: Number of conditional probabilities for categorical columns exceeds limit. Columns '{column_name_or_index_1}' and '{column_name_or_index_2}' are the problematic pair.

Exception.Description: Number of columns in the dataset exceeds allowed limit.

Messages.Default: Number of columns in the dataset exceeds allowed limit.
Messages.Message: Number of columns in the dataset in '{dataset_name}' exceeds allowed.
Number of columns in the dataset in '{dataset_name}' exceeds allowed limit of '{component_name}'.
Number of columns in the dataset in '{dataset_name}' exceeds allowed '{limit_columns_count}' limit of '{component_name}'.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when label column is missing or has insufficient number of labeled rows.

Messages.Default: Exception occurs when label column is missing or has insufficient number of labeled rows.
Messages.Message: Exception occurs when label column is missing or has less than {required_rows_count} labeled rows.
Exception occurs when label column in dataset {dataset_name} is missing or has less than {required_rows_count} labeled rows.

Exception.Description: Memory has been exhausted, unable to complete running of module. Downsampling the dataset may help to alleviate the problem.

Messages.Default: Memory has been exhausted, unable to complete running of module.
Messages.Message: Memory has been exhausted, unable to complete running of module. Details: {details}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if the number of the selected numerical columns and unique values in categorical and string columns is too small.

Messages.Default: The number of the selected numerical columns and unique values in the categorical and string columns is too small.
Messages.Message: The total number of the selected numerical columns and unique values in the categorical and string columns (currently {actual_num}) should be at least {lower_boundary}.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when user try to join data on key columns with incompatible column type.

Messages.Default: Key column element types are not compatible.
Messages.Message: Key column element types are not compatible.(left: {keys_left}; right: {keys_right})

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when column names of dataset are not string.

Messages.Default: The dataframe column name must be string type. Column names are not string.
Messages.Message: The dataframe column name must be string type. Column names {column_names} are not string.

Exception.Description: Exception occurs when failed to read data from Azure SQL Database.

Messages.Default: Failed to read data from Azure SQL Database.

Exception.Description: Datastore not found.

Messages.Default: Datastore information is invalid.
Messages.Message: Datastore information is invalid. Failed to get AzureML datastore '{datastore_name}' in workspace '{workspace_name}'.

Exception.Description: Thrown when a transformation directory is invalid

Messages.Default: Given TransformationDirectory is invalid.
Messages.Message: TransformationDirectory "{arg_name}" is invalid. Reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Exception occurs if passed to module model directory is invalid.

Messages.Default: Given ModelDirectory is invalid.
Messages.Message: ModelDirectory "{arg_name}" is invalid.
ModelDirectory "{arg_name}" is invalid. Reason: {reason}.
ModelDirectory "{arg_name}" is invalid. Reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Thrown when error occurred during writing output files to disk.

Messages.Default: Failed to write output files to disk.
Messages.Message: Failed to write output files to disk. Reason: {reason}. {troubleshoot_hint}

Exception.Description: Internal library exception.

Messages.Default: Library exception.
Messages.Message: Library exception: {exception}.
Unknown library exception: {exception}. {customer_support_guidance}.
